decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a game-ending attack. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect and enable the combo. Additionally, cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent provide additional threats and versatility. The mana base is optimized for consistency and can disrupt opponents with Wasteland and Undercity Sewers.

This Doomsday combo deck aims to win the game by stacking your deck with Thassa?s Oracle and Street Wraith using Doomsday. The deck includes a variety of cantrips, disruption, and rituals to help assemble the combo and protect it from opponent's interference. With careful sequencing and planning, you can set up a winning game-ending Thassa?s Oracle trigger in one turn, avoiding the need to rely on attacking or other traditional win conditions. The deck's core strategy revolves around setting up this combo efficiently and effectively to secure victory.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly play low-cost creatures and utilize the Ninjas in the deck to deal damage to the opponent while also drawing cards and gaining advantage. There is a mix of disruption spells like Fatal Push and Force of Will to control the board, while also providing additional utility with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck aims to be aggressive and take advantage of its efficient creatures and evasive Ninjas to pressure the opponent and win the game quickly.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, and then bring them back into play for a powerful and explosive combo. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the game, along with versatile cards like Brainstorm and Force of Will for card advantage and protection. With a strong mana base including Underground Sea and Wasteland, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to use Show and Tell to cheat out either Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Omniscience onto the battlefield. The deck includes various counterspells and cantrips to protect the combo, as well as Cunning Wish to tutor for specific cards from the sideboard. The inclusion of The One Ring and LÃ³rien Revealed adds redundancy to the combo, while Stock Up allows for card advantage. Veil of Summer protects against disruption, making this deck a powerful and consistent combo deck in the Legacy format.

This deck aims to quickly play out a large number of spells to combo off and win the game in a single turn. The goal is to use cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly, while also using cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Elvish Spirit Guide to help cast multiple spells in a turn. The key combo pieces include Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill your entire deck, followed by Dread Return to reanimate Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck is all-in on this combo and is highly explosive, but also vulnerable to disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces and control the game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier while utilizing cards like Brazen Borrower and Fatal Push for additional disruption. The mana base is designed to support both the combo and control aspects of the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly put powerful creatures from the graveyard into play using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Daze, while also providing card advantage and control with Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower. The land base is optimized for consistency and mana fixing, with options for disruption through Wasteland and Undercity Sewers. The deck's goal is to assemble its combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by utilizing a combination of hand disruption spells, removal spells, and counterspells. The deck aims to control the pace of the game through card advantage and efficient removal, while also utilizing powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Murktide Regent to pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control elements, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the "Cephalid Breakfast" combo, which involves using Nomads en-Kor and Cephalid Illusionist to mill through the library and put Narcomoeba and Thassa's Oracle onto the battlefield. This combo allows the player to win the game immediately by drawing a card with little to no interaction from the opponent. The deck efficiently protects the combo with counterspells like Force of Will and disruption spells like Swords to Plowshares, while also utilizing card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary pieces.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents through denying resources with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Wasteland, while applying pressure with aggressive creatures such as Flickerwisp and Skyclave Apparition. Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard provide consistent tutor power to find needed pieces like Kaldra Compleat or Swords to Plowshares, creating a versatile and dynamic strategy. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds a unique element of value and flexibility to the deck, allowing for increased card advantage and better board presence.

The focus of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces necessary to win the game using the card Doomsday. The deck includes a variety of cantrip spells and interaction to facilitate finding and protecting the combo pieces. By carefully planning and executing the Doomsday sequence, the player can set up a winning combination of cards to secure victory in the game. The deck also includes cards that can disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect the combo, ensuring a higher chance of success.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping into powerful dragon creatures and overwhelming the opponent with burn spells and disruptive artifacts. By utilizing mana acceleration cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox, the deck can quickly deploy threats like Tersa Lightshatter and Pyrogoyf. Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Fury and Shatterskull Smashing provide removal and additional reach. The deck aims to close out the game quickly by utilizing its aggressive creatures and burn spells.

The deck focuses on quickly milling through the entire deck and then using graveyard recursion to win the game with a limited number of cards left. It relies on a combination of fast mana acceleration, self-milling creatures, and spells that interact with the graveyard to achieve its win condition. The key strategy is to get key combo pieces into the graveyard, such as Thassa's Oracle, and then bring them back onto the battlefield to win the game in a single turn. The deck is designed to be aggressive and win as quickly as possible.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield for a strong offense. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo pieces and control the opponent's plays. The deck aims to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with the powerful creatures being reanimated, while also having some versatility with cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bringing them back into play for a low cost with Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The deck aims to win the game through overwhelming the opponent with big creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also having the flexibility to control the game with cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student.
